question: 訪ねる
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>visit</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to visit</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: You want <vocabulary>to visit</vocabulary> your friend <reading>Taz</reading> (<ja>たず</ja>) the Tasmanian Devil. He's your best bro, so imagine visiting him and having a good time and saying you're going to visit him again.
